title: TotalEnergies’ $20 Billion Mozambique LNG Project Back on Track
summary: TotalEnergies and its partners are close to restarting construction and engineering work on the huge $20-billion LNG export facility in Mozambique after the companies lifted the four-year-long force majeure on the project. title: Oilfield Services Firm Petrofac Collapses
summary: After years of restructuring and cost-cutting efforts, UK-listed oilfield services group Petrofac on Monday filed for administration, following the termination of its biggest contract. title: Bars and coins steal the shine from jewelry as Indians splurge up to $11 billion on gold this Diwali
summary: Indians bought up to $11 billion of gold in the Diwali week. But more gold was sold in the form of coins and bars than jewelry.

title: Shale Giants Slash Thousands of Jobs as Lower Prices Bite
summary: U.S. oil and gas producers seek efficiencies and cost reductions amid lower oil prices this year compared to 2024 levels. title: Norway Leads Global EV Adoption
summary: With sales continuing to thrive in many countries, the global market for battery electric vehicles (BEVs) surpassed the 10 million annual sales mark for the first time in 2024, with sales up nearly 10 percent compared to 2023. title: US sanctions threaten major blow to Russian oil groups Rosneft and Lukoil
summary: Decision risks upending the industry by disrupting exports and forcing both companies to adapt
